body_html: @elistevens Note that an implicit getattr there could be very misleading in some cases. For example, when serializing a model with DataParallel, you save the module. name of it in the parameters, so if you want to load these parameters in a model without DataParallel, it will error out. But using the indirect getattr, it would be harder to debug it.
body_text: @elistevens Note that an implicit getattr there could be very misleading in some cases. For example, when serializing a model with DataParallel, you save the module. name of it in the parameters, so if you want to load these parameters in a model without DataParallel, it will error out. But using the indirect getattr, it would be harder to debug it.
body: @elistevens Note that an implicit getattr there could be very misleading in some cases. For example, when serializing a model with DataParallel, you save the `module.` name of it in the parameters, so if you want to load these parameters in a model without DataParallel, it will error out. But using the indirect getattr, it would be harder to debug it.
